definition: to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
(onom.) for humming or whimpering
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out

sentences.english: This bird employs its beak as a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 用鸟喙啄了几下就让这条蛇一命呜呼了。

sentences.english: If it had hit them, they could have all been killed.
sentences.chinese: 如果当时真打中他们，他们可能全都一命呜呼。

sentences.english: A bullet through the heart ended her.
sentences.chinese: 一粒子弹穿心过肺，使她一命呜呼。

sentences.english: He died of a broken neck.
It was enough to give a cheer last month when he rasped his last sour breath.
sentences.chinese: 就那次足以让我为他上个月的一命呜呼欢呼了。

sentences.english: Some evening night returns, rance encounters a serious traffic accident, result die.
sentences.chinese: 某晚夜归，兰斯遭遇一场严重车祸，结果一命呜呼。

definition: see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]
to meet violent death/to get killed
to be decapitated (idiom)
(coll.) to die/to kick the bucket
see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]
to die suddenly
to die/to drop dead
to lose one's life
to die/to breathe one's last
to fall gravely ill, never to recover (idiom)
to take one's last breath/dying
to die/to perish
violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]
to meet one's Maker/to die
